findings.title: The same merkle proof can be consumed multiple times
findings.description: A valid merkle proof can be consumed multiple times because the function `hasValidMerkleProof` does not mark a proof that was used as consumed, allowing one malicious address to circumvent this gating mechanism completely.

findings.title: Burn window is not necessarily one consecutive window
findings.description: The administrative function `setBurnWindow` can be called at any time, allowing the owner to start a second burn window after the first one has ended or extend it indefinitely, resulting in non-consecutive burn windows.

findings.title: Merkle root can be unset with allowListEnabled
findings.description: A `merkleRoot` can be set to anything in `setMerkleRoot` regardless of the smart contract state. If this `merkleRoot` is set to 0 while `allowlistEnabled` is true, `hasValidMerkleProof` can be bypassed.
